text: Nice food. Terrific murals. It's worth coming here justice to see the paintings. Service was extremely slow. Get the the tamales to go.
Great Cocido. Lots of vegetables, potato, and beef. Everything was cooked great. Best Cocido in Las Vegas. Great service as well. Highly recommend.

Was referred by a friend because I was looking for some good tamales to have for Christmas dinner.  So this was my 1st time going here.  I ordered 2 dozen tamales.  I got a dozen pork and 6 cheese 6 of the other flavor they have but I cant remember what it was at the moment...chicken & green sauce I think??   The cheese ones were ok ...too much cheese for me.  The chicken & green sauce were very yummy but my fav was the pork tamales.  I will be getting tamales from here every Christmas from now on.   Would like to dine in and try some of their other food.

My family and I went for breakfast and I thought the breakfast menu could be a little bigger but they have what you need to be satisfied. I had the chilaquiles , my husband had menudo and my mother in law had a sweet tamale and menudo as well. We ordered tamales to go oh and we also had coffee and the coffee is the type that is cooked in a pot and spiced with cinnamon.Will be going there again!

I missed mexican food since i'm from california, always pass by this place coz i live on Cheyanne and surprisingly enough i like it alot. i would go back...the tamales are no joke. its prolly just as good as that one lady who sells them after church rite when you get out for like a dollar except Dona Maria sells them for much more. its worth it though. i would suggest buying in bulk though since its cheaper than buying it individually.  Had a 2 item plate, pork tamale and 2 cheese enchiladas with beans and rice and an horchata...have to have the horchata, chips and salsa are complimentary.  very mexican decor overall...if you gotta a hankerin for some decent mexcian food and not robertos status then have this place. its delicious!

Our family really enjoys this place for breakfast.  We moved here from South Texas where Mexican food (Jalisco Style...not Tex Mex) is king.  Their chiquiles are amazing, and heuvos rancheros are good as well.  Surprisingly they also serve some of the best pancakes around!  Great Mexican coffee and hot chocolate.  Home made chips and tortillas are a must for us and theirs are great!  Also tried some tamales and really enjoyed them as well.  Only real disappointment was the sopapillas.   Too doughy, almost cakelike.  Not light and fluffy like we like.
Way over priced for bad Mexican food the chips were stale and the portions were tiny. Won't be going back
We stopped to eat .. was very disappointed the salsa tastes like spegetti sauce with a few pepper seeds in it. Overall was not happy with the food.

Something here has really changed. I have always liked Dona Marias. But I have been here twice in the past few weeks and the food is different. I used to love the Shrimp and Octopus cocktail but my last two visits it has not been what it used to be. I had a chili rellano and taco today and both had what seemed to be more of a catsup based sauce than before. The taco was in a hard  "taco bell" type shell. Very disappointed.

I've come here before, but it's been a while. I used to like the tamales here but tonight was not impressive. Took a while for anyone to come to get our drink order once we sat down, after we got our food, we had no one refill our drink cups or chips which they usually refill, and we had to ask for the check after a while of being done with our food. 
The food was not that good, it was mushy and the tamales used to have more sauce... It was over priced too.
Awesome as usual!! Good service, good food. What more do you want? Chips and Salsa, Awesome! Looking for a locals place not loaded with tourists. This is it.

Overall not impressed with this dining experience. We tried a chicken taco, steak burrito (enchilada style) and the chicken tamales. The chicken taco tasted like fast food, and the steak burrito was mediocre. The chicken tamales were the highlight of the meal, absolutely fantastic. To top it off, service was slow and food is over priced for what you get.

We have been going to Dona Maria's for so many years and it is consistently delicioso!  They do have great tamales but what I come here for is ...BREAKFAST!

First, maybe I come for breakfast just so I can order the COFFEE.  This is my absolute fav!  It's a subtly spiced coffee, cinnamonny and yummy.  Get the coffee.

Next, they have delicious garlicy SALSA, warm, authentic tortilla CHIPS that come with your meal... and on some days - homemade TORTILLAS! 

Third - the red sauce.  I always get the TORTA DE HUEVO with hashbrowns and beans.  This is a mexican omelet with potatoes, onion, and peppers topped with that smoooooth red chile sauce and melted, gooey cheese. The perfect comfort food brunch!

I also love the decor and the staff has been mostly the same servers for years. They are always friendly and prompt!
I love the food here. I've been eating here for years. The fajitas are delicious,  so are the nachos, tacos and burritos. The atmosphere is very laid back

Known for the tamales and they are good.  We were just passing threw town and it was by our hotel.  I'm not sure what all the lower ratings are about -- it is just like all the other Mexican restaurants I have eaten at across several states.  I thought it was cool to be able to order tamales by the 1/2 dozen or full dozen.

It amazes me that this place gets anything over one star.  Maybe this is California Mexican, but it is not Texas border Mexican.  We picked up tamales for a birthday party.  Ordered 2 dozen.  Received only one dozed packed in a plastic bag all mashed together.  A mess.  Called and they redid the order.  Still a mess - sweet tamales packed with chicken and cheese.  Really?  No pride in how they were sent out.  Tamales were tasteless and greasy.  HUGE disappointment.  And $$$!  $24 for a dozen.  Sent home salsa and chips in the bag - salsa tasted like Ragu and chips were greasy and again, no flavor.  This is NOT authentic Mexican - don't waste your time here.  There are many other places in town to eat good Mexican, and if you are in a rush, you'll get more flavor and authenticity at El Pollo Loco or Taco Bell.  Yes, it was that bad!

The food is average. Nothing horrible but nothing outstanding. I had the carne asada salad. Most people wouldn't complain about getting mostly steak in the salad but it was all steak, onions and bell peppers in a crunchy tortilla bowl. Not really a salad to me. The carne asada was pretty tasty though. The free chips and salsa were pretty good.

I am a fan of Mexican food and I love Chavelas.  I've been searching for a Mexican restaurant that makes these in Vegas.  I was apprehensive when the waiter asked me how this drink is made... then excited when he said they could make it... then slightly disappointed again when they brought the drink to the table.  Not what I am looking for.  But things improved as the food came to the table.  

I had the pork tamales and Chiliquiles.  Both were above average and the homemade tortillas were outstanding.  Chips and salsa were very basic but had a good flavor.

Last Night my wife and I went to this restaurant. Since tamales are my favorite, I selected this restaurant. Decor was open and the bathroom clean. Service was ok., but not good. I ordered a beef tamale and my wife ordered cheese enchilada. We also ordered the guacamole. The guacamole was simply pureed avocado. No onion, no garlic, no tomato, no avocado chunks, no FLAVOR. The tamale was so bad I had to send them back twice without any change of result. My wife could barely eat the enchilada citing the lack of flavor. I eat in a wide variety of restaurants and food selections. In memory this is by far the WORST FOOD I HAVE EVER EATEN. My suggestion is if you want Mexican food you can eat. Don't go there - run like hell. I would prefer Ricardo's any day over this place. Save your money, but more importantly save your palate and your stomach.

Best margaritas on the rocks EVER!
The service can be a little slow, but they were pretty busy and our server was very nice and had a great personality.
The fajitas come out sizzling and so juicy.
They even have home made tortillas to go with them.

Overall an awesome experience. Good food. Great staff. And not too bad of pricing for the amount of food.
Hesitating to come in because of all the bad reviews ....but let me  the food was good . Walter our waiter was the best the drinks he made were  amazing.
Family & I went since  we love Mexican food. The food was average but I would rather go to Roberto's for my tacos. To us it was a one timer!
I love the bistec con huevos - great service unless its super busy - then it feels understaffed. Great authentic Mexican in the old style of Vegas sit down Mexican Restaurantery.

I am SUPER picky... But this place is a complete win EVERY time I go. From the amazing tamales...to their fresh cocktail and the friendly wait staff, this is a MUST when I'm in the mood for mexcian food!

Talk about a great Mexican experience!  These guys are the bomb.  I always start with the queso fundido, and then any number of options (accompanied by a pitcher of their margaritas, of course).  Been coming here for over 10 year and will continue to do so.

Man, I just love this place. It's become my go-to comfort food over the last dozen years of coming here. Love the homemade flour tortillas, the chicken fajitas (enough for 2 or lunch the next day), the pork tamales, the tortilla soup and the margaritas. The food has always tasted the same, the staff are the same faces year after year, and -- the best part -- I am never, ever rushed when I'm here. Just sit down, relax, enjoy the complimentary chips and sip on your drink. When I need to unwind and let somebody else cook, this is my place.

Sheesh 27 dollars for Lunch for 2 with water to drink!?!? WTF

Pros: Staff is very friendly.
the inside decore is very well done.
Service was quick and on point.

Cons: Quality of food is just MEH... 
We had the seed pod and all still attached to the bell pepper in my food... not acceptable to service the garbage parts of veg when your charging 13 dollars...
Obviously the prices are out of control.
The "Lunch menu" should not average out to about 11 dollars a plate... not including soda.

Staff was nice but the food quality does NOT justify the price.  Wont be returning.
I wanted to like this place, but they charged me $4 extra for a side of rice.  And this is not any kind of special rice - just the same kind they have at Roberto's for $1.

My company attempted to place an order for lunch at this restaurant today only to be called back 30 minutes after the order was placed to inform us the order was cancelled because "they were too busy". We ordered tamales keep in mind. A food item they specialize in and should be able to crank out. I'm no expert in business management but turning away customers in a day and age when you can have literally any restaurants food delivered to you doesn't seem like a smart business model. At least notify the customer immediately so they are not anticipating food for half and hour. I'll take my business somewhere it's appreciated next time.

Bland tamales, lukewarm rice and not so great customer service. I ordered the chicken and beef tamales and a mango margarita. Never receieved the margarita and the tamales didn't taste as good as the looked. Oh, and did I memntion that once out food was delivered, the waiter never returned?
The waiters are very rude they make you feel like you're a bather and on top of that sarcastic and  with no personality..  I m never coming back!!

The service is always great. I enjoy the chips and salsa. I have not been disappointed with the food although the prices are out of control. Two weeks ago my husband asked for sour cream and was charged $3.00.

I went here Sunday night for dinner, I have been here a number of times throughout the years and I guess I go back because of the convenience. However, whenever I go back I just can't find myself impressed with the food or the decor, the restaurant feels like a cafeteria.  The tamales are decent, pretty good for Las Vegas. I had the two tamale combo for $11.99, including rice and beans and soup or salad. I chose the albondigas which was homemade meatballs but a bit salty. Drinks were refilled promptly and without comment as to how many ice teas were drunk, which I appreciate but just overall I think that this definitely falls into the "meh..." Category as far as the food for me. I would probably rank it more of a 2 1/2.

Food is average and the service is always horrible and I do not know why I go back. I guess I keep hoping the service improves but it does not. If I knew anything about operating a Mexican restaurant I would open up next door to them and I am sure with average food and good service  I would put them in the ground.
The Midori Margaritas are amazing! We had the carne asada tacos. They were cooked to perfection!

Awesome!  I went there for a simple burrito and they gave me some chips and dip as a bonus.....without asking!   

The food is good.

So I have been at both the DT and the North Las Vegas local. 

There are a couple of things that are really good---the chips are awesome, the shrimp wrapped in bacon (leave the sauce off) and the  coffee are fabulous! 

The rest is the same as throwing a Patio dinner in the microwave. Tamales...I hear they are good but I was not taking any chances. The service is also hit or miss. 

If this is the only option...stay home

Really disappointed... I tried the cheese, beef, &chicken tamale. I didn't like any of them.. the texture was of the meat was off and the combination of cheeses weren't very good. I've seen ads around town& decided to five them a try but I wouldn't recommend this.

After hearing all the hype we finally decided to go and get some tamales, unfortunately we ordered a dozen (some to take home of course!) before we tried them.  While waiting for our order we were served chips and salsa and were very disappointed.  It was obvious they don't roast their ingredients and it just tasted like tomato.  My wife asked for a spicier salsa or something more authentic and they brought another but still disappointing.  The tamales and accompanying sides were also very bland and not very good.  This place reminds me of a cafeteria and the food is definitely not authentic.  Don't waste your time or money, we will not be going back.

Ewwww.. Dirty sticky floors & menus, they clearly haven't dumped and washed their S&P shakers in years. Dusty blinds and everything is old, gross. Food bland, bland, bland and nothing special. Never going back.

Back to Dona Maria's on my last trip recently and gosh the menudo is really so good. I just crave it. Tried the chicken tamales too this time and they are really good.

Is it July yet!!!  set the table here I come!!

We've eaten here a handful of times and each time it's worst than the last. I ordered a tamale tonight and it smelled and tasted like an old wet sock. My boyfriend ordered a shredded beef taco and it too tasted terrible! The meat was black and tasted nothing like beef. We ordered to go so it wasn't like we can send the plates back :/

Now, I'm in bed with chills and an upset stomach. I seriously hope this isn't the beginnings of food poisoning. We've decided NEVER to eat Doña Maria ever again.

The service was not terrible but was not good either. My mom ordered the beef fajitas and the beef was over cooked. I ordered 1 chicken and 1 cheese tamale. The cheese was cold, so I informed them of it, they took it & it was as if they warmed the tamale up in the microwave. I will not return to this restaurant or refer it to someone else.

Cheese enchiladas compete for the best i've ever had... The tamales weren't that great.  I'm surprised they're mentioned in the name.  
The tacos are really saucy, which was a little weird, but really good. 
Food came out very quickly, and I have no complaints with the service.   I will definitely be back.
Terrible. Bad service. Server asked what we wanted and we never saw him again. Food tasted so bad. Not coming back. Sorry.

They get a 1 star cause there's nothing lower. How they got a 3 1/2 stars idk. Nothing about this place is authentic. Everything tasted like it was from a can, even the rice and I don't think there is rice in a can. We got the very over priced tamales which there named after to try them and sent them all back. Some were very burnt that we couldn't eat it and some were not even cooked. ( still watery inside). All the food is extremely expensive like $20 for 2 tacos and a green enchilada. Iced tea was $3 and soda $3.15. And even the soda was flat. The service was ehh, they finally asked if i wanted a refill when I was leaving.

I'm always on the hunt for yummy Mexican eats. Dona Maria has long had my curiosity since I love me a tamal. Restaurant.com had $10 dining certificates at a discount which provided me with the perfect excuse to give 'em a try.

Dined in last night, only a few tables were dining. It was quiet and service was attentive. We asked for a hotter salsa than the one given and they came back with a delicious smoky spicy option, Chipotle, if I had to guess. It was excellent. We loved the heat. Albondigas soup followed, it was pretty good, I enjoyed the flavorful meatballs. Both entrees were combos: tamal enchilada style and beef & bean burrito, and chile relleno and cheese and chili tamal. It was fine, but highly Americanized. This gringa likes the real deal so it was a disappointment. I thought the tamales would be better since it's in the name. On it's own it was a bit bland and dry, it needed more zest. So the enchilada style went over better. I covered mine in the yummy hot salsa and it did the trick.

It's not a bad option, but there is better around. 2.5 stars.

Came here for dinner this evening and was very disappointed. First, the prices are extremely high for Mexican food, nothing scared upscale but the prices! Food was very tomato based with all theor meat in some for of sauce. I love Mexican it's one of my favorite foods to eat but this was by far the worst tasting food I have had in a long time. Very blame. Just horrible. I'm giving a 1 star for the nice gentleman that served us. Other then that, this place would be a NO star...!
Been here just once and ordered their chicken taco salad. Quantity is a lot. Finished it all and I was more than satisfied!

Been there 2 times now and both times the service was good but the food not so much for a restaurant that's name is doña Maria TAMALES their tamales suck and the other dish I had previously wasn't good either! The soup and salad was the only thing good .

We have been coming to Tamales for many, many years and we eat here so much (1-3x per week) we feel like family!!  We know all the wait and host staff quite well and they are all AMAZING!!  LOVE their food!  Whatever they marinate the fajitas in makes them so delicious.  The tamales are the most moist I have ever had!  Love the chile Rellenos.  Love their hot, chipotle salsa and pico!  The fruit margaritas are excellent, the best I've ever had!  

Suggestions:  Would love to see table side guacamole and chili con queso dip offered.  Would also love to see some new items added occasionally or maybe a chef's special.  You rarely can hear the music, latin music will add to the atmosphere.  Also, let the wait staff where polo shirts!

Food is always great.  Pretty much always order a chili releno and an enchilada - ala carte.  Excellent!  I do think the prices on the tamales (which has gone up) is more than they should be.  I used to get a half dozen to take home, but this comes to too much.  Would like to see not more than $3.00.  Love the dessert ones with pineapple and raisins.

An enjoyable experience, but not an excellent one. This place gets an A-OK rating from me because their tamales really are delicious and their margaritas are strong and reasonably priced. I didn't give it a higher rating, however, because the rest of the food at our table was very bland.

Delish:
-tamales! I had the cheese, my lunch date had the pork - both were really good. Mine was even good without being enchilada-style.
-fresh, hot, house-made chips
-"jumbo" margaritas were only $8 each and plenty enough for one entire meal!

Meh:
-salsa (not spicy at all and kinda flavorless)
-taco (hard-shell) with beans, guac, lettuce, tomato (reeeeeally bland)
-beans & rice (not the best, not the worst. just meh.)

I WOULD come here again, but I'd know to only order the tamales and the margaritas and ask for spicier salsa.

Carne Asada was absolutely to die for! The salsa had a unique twist to it too! Even tho the bf and I came right be great closing, the service was fantastic and everyone was very nice to us. The refried beans were a little bland but thats nothing major. Definitely returning!

Not far from our house so we decided to try, never again!  Ordered a mojito, which is displayed prominently on the menu.  Tasted like battery acid.  Told the server who said yea we don't have mint or lime so they don't taste great!  What?  then ordered a margarita, which was so bad I didn't even drink it.  I don't think they have a bar or a bartender think they just make stuff up where they get sodas and such.  Salsa was really bland.  chips were ok, thick which was good.  Ordered an a la carte burrito, a la carte tostada and one cheese enchilada.  Food was really bland and honestly taco bell has more taste than this place.  I guess being from L.A. I am kind of a mexican food snob but this place was horrible.  Bill was $30 way overpriced and food was disgusting.  Would never let anyone I know eat there.

I can't comment on any of the food really because I only ever get the nachos. They are phenomenal. My husband and I get a small nacho with carne asada and strawberry margaritas. The service is always awesome and the nachos never disappoint. I bring friends and family from out of town all the time and always after we leave they tell me hands down best nachos ever. I have been going here for 14 years now and will continue to be a loyal customer.

SO GOOD. I went here with a larger family party. We had amazing service, delicious food, and a great time. While I just ordered some simple enchiladas, they were well-prepared, delicious, etc and other members of the party ordered tamales and other dishes & reported they were great. I really enjoyed the salsa and I thought the guacamole was good verging on so-so. Will definitely be back, this is the place to be when you want good food and good service.

I tried making tamales this holiday season and failed miserably! But that didn't make my craving go away. So I ordered a dozen from this restaurant. I got 4 pork, 4 chicken, and 4 cheese. The masa was delicious and not too thick. The fillings were all great. I've lived in the northwest for over 20years and never tried them before! Now I will be a loyal customer. Excellent!

The food here is very authentic. I love the amount of food they give you! Price may be a tad more pricey. For the portion size and quality, it is well worth it. Only thing is, if you order to go, at times the wait is long.
The Mexican food was so good!! I had the Pork Tamales, Chicken Burrito, and Chile Relleno. Friendly and good service. Margaritas were impressive. Definitely will be coming back here for more!!
My parents are regulars here and we always eat here when we visit.  Tamales are great.  Also service is great.

5 star for friendly service & beautiful decor. Cute date spot. Too bad food was disappointing. Everything was bland & over cooked. Nothing was seasoned. Tamales were old??? Just tasted like boiled pork that sat in water too long. Not the place to go for Mexican food but nice to hang out for snacks. Chips were fresh & grilled prawns wrapped in bacon was yummy.

Another great Tamale lunch. Whenever we make it back to Las Vegas we make sure to stop in for lunch or dinner. We have never had a bad lunch here throughout the years. You can't go wrong with their Tamales.

Fresh and amazing flour tortilla's!  Blows away any Mexican food I've ate in a Casino.  I had the Carne Asada Platter which they subsititute a NY Strip steak instead of the thin flank steak that I'm used to.  The steak was prepared perfectly and a nice change to the norm.  The restaurant is clean and I've been there twice now. I'll definitely go back.

Let me begin by saying that I grew up in SoCal and have traveled extensively throughout the southwest and had my fill of Mexican food, looking for the good stuff.  The two dishes I look for are tamals and chile rellenos:  both specialty dishes that require careful attention to detail, and both of which can be done badly.  

Dona Maria's had the BEST tamals AND chile rellenos I have ever had.  First, the tamals:  most places have a thin layer of meat wrapped in corn meal.  Here, you have a rather sizable portion of meat wrapped in a thin layer of corn meal.  

Next, the chile rellenos.  If you don't do them right, you have a gloppy, oil-soaked eggy mess.  Dona Maria's were done perfectly:  crispy and filling.

My girlfriend and I frequent here often either by ourselves or with friends. I have to say, they have the BEST CADILLAC MARGARITAS I have ever tasted. We buy them by the pitcher. Still trying to figure out how they are made. The food is good. I have had some better, some worse. Chips and salsa are yummy and the customer service has always been subperb. If you haven't tried Tamales, please do yourself a favor and stop on by. Start off with a nice Cadillac Margarita and enjoy the evening. If you have had too much, you can always go drunk shopping across the street at Target lol.

This place id freakin HUGE! II'm telling you, huge. We went for some yummy hangover food, this did the trick. Loved the tortilla soup, for sure. It's simple, good, fast, clean, friendly. I need to go, again, and order other things, so I can give a better review. This place is huge.

But really a 3.5. 
Chicken tamales all day
I'm telling you... Chicken tamales
We tried the beef and pork but seemed overcooked
Beef chimichanga... Just okay
Meat again seemed chewey 

The tortilla maker on display was a nice touch
The corn tortilla on the carne asada taco was obviously fresh and worked well with the other ingredients. 

Margaritas...
Bomb
We tried mango on the rocks and a strawberry banana blended both were delicious 

Service was terrific. 
Francisco was very friendly and knowledgeable 
Will be back at the cantina for more tamales and margaritas

Great food and  excellent service  got our food fast people here are very polite and very clean there tamales are great they give u free chips and Salas which is great not to hot. I defiantly will be back with my family and will recommend them to everyone.

Very decent Mexican food =) 
Loved the shrimp and crab enchiladas.
Tried the Fajita Chicken and Beef mixed, is one of the best I tried. Other foods though are OK. Servings are huge!!

Yeah :) Tamales here are awesome :) My husband and I were driving around and decided we would stop when something sounded good for dinner....Mexican sounded good. So, we got our pacificos and ordered some tamales and a burrito. The been burrito was nothing special, but the cheese tamales were incredible!! My hubby really liked the chicken ones as well. We will definitely be back to eat more tamales. They were excellent and made for happy food babies in out bellies :)

Probably the best authentic Mexican restaurant in Vegas love this location! The food is always cooked perfectly and it taste as if it's homemade. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone craving this type of food, love it!

I wasn't that crazy about this place. It is very spacious inside but they weren't very busy for dinner time. The chips and salsa brought to the table was a joke. The salsa was very sweet and thin. The chips were very hard, almost stale. The albondigas soup was the only thing worth eating. The soup had good flavor.  For dinner I tried the fajitas and the meat was tough and lacked flavor. The beans and rice that came with my fajitas was dry and crispy like it was heated up from earlier. When it came time for dessert our table shared a plate of churros. The churros were very dry and most of the cinnamon and sugar was at the bottom of the plate. Our server was good but the food wasn't. I can't see coming back.

Im a 55 yr old male and grew up in san diego close to the border . I'm a big fan of Mexican food and have been eating it all my life . when I went here I was hoping to discover a new mexican restaurant to eat at that was good . Boy was I let down. I ordered the combination 2 tacos and enchilada . not only did it look disgusting when I got it ,it was disgusting as well . My schreaded beef tacos were cooked in enchilada sauce. tasted like my enchilada but  in a taco shell, very soggy and messy . when I inquired on my way out what the sauce was they said it was indeed enchilada sauce . When I ask why in the heck you would put that on a taco? They said you have to request it not to be put on it . I told them it never dawned on me to have to order a taco without enchilada sauce . they said sorry , and I said its your problem not mine . There were no Mexicans eating here my wife pointed out , guess that's a good sign the food sucks .. BtW my wife carnitas burrito was bad, the rice was dry and tasteless . the actual enchilada was very salty . On a brighter note the beer was good along with the chips and salsa , beans so so

The first time I went there was on a Tuesday right before closing, the food was great and the tamales were fresh and delicious.

I was back in vegas, went in there for lunch and fell sick and the smell and taste of the tamales and enchilada. It wasn't the same. and they had gone up in price?
I probably won't go here again unless it's for a churo :)
Service and seating was a little slow but the food was excellent and the servers are very polite my favorite local Mexican place by far!

I'm pretty sure I have mild food poisoning from this place. I was feeling it as we were leaving-  my food was not good at all. . I ordered the chicken salad which said chicken breast and it came w crumbled chicken. I couldn't tell what it was. I ate it anyway. The egg was way over cooked. The guac (which was market price?!???) had NO flavor. Add some garlic salt cilantro, onion and lime guys...  
my husbands Tamale was mediocre at best. But I feel sick- something in that salad is not sitting right. Never again.

We have been here a half dozen times since moving to Las Vegas a couple months ago. The food has always been on point and I am picky! Sometimes the service can be a little slow, and the margaritas can use some work, but they get job done! Definitely our go to place so far!
Good chips and salsa. Food was good and came out fast. Just a little pricey but not too bad. $3.25 margaritas for happy hour

We came in an hour before the place closed. I had at one time lived around the corner but hadn't tried it. We walked in place was big. Felt a little bit like a cafeteria. Sat right away. The beverage person got our drinks fairly quickly. There were two tables and it took the waiter some time to greet and take our order. I ordered a side of guacamole like I do at every Mexican restaurant. Needless to say I was not impressed. It looked and tasted like it was from the grocery store. Our main entrees were good. I had a couple of enchiladas, and my friend had a burrito. Took awhile for the waiter to come by and refill the drinks. He was talking a lot to the other table that was seated. Price point was ok. Place didn't wow, not sure if I'll come back.

Every dish I have had here is amazing (and we frequent this place about once a month). Also, their margarita's are not for the faint of heart! 1 margarita = a very good buzz and you are satisfied for the night! The staff is always on it and the restaurant is child and large group friendly. Our neighborhood go to for Mexican food.

This place was such a disappointment. As you walk in there is a smell I think it's the carpeting. But we wanted to try these tamales so we stayed. The chips and salsa were served and these were not fresh at all. Both the salsa and chips tasted store bought. The food was not much better the enchilada sauce lacked flavor and the shredded beef inside the enchilada and taco was mushy. The beans I have tasted before but I can't place it. Now the tamale. So not worth $4.00 each. The masa was bland and the pork inside again was mush. The only good thing  here was the tortilla soup and the service. The empty parking lot and dinning area should have been a clue that this place is no good.

Love this place. Wonderful restaurant to get authentic Mexican food or a relaxing margarita. For the price the meals are well portioned. You will feel at home with the wonderful food and courteous staff.

I thought the food was pretty good. The salsa was flavorful, and the nacho appetizer was good. I did not have the signature tamales, instead We ordered a bean burrito. Nothing special, but not disappointing. If I can ever figure out how to post pictures, I will. I thought it was a good value.

I went here last night for the first time. My first thought was the prices are crazy expensive for mexican food. The tamales where ok. not the best I have had but filled with alot of meat, not spicy at all. The fajitas were normal size serving. The beer and drinks are also on the high end. 5$ for a bud light bottle.

I gave this place 3 stars do to the price and normal plain Jane dishes. But on the bright side. The service was top notch and very attentive. They also have the best in house made  flour tortillas.

I will only be going back if I ever have a tortilla craving. So far best mexican food/drink in summerlin is casa don Juan. Flavorful food and decent prices. And good drink prices as well. Service is good to.

So 5 bucks a tamale. 5 bucks...  I got the pork one enchilada style with rancho sauce.  It was burned on the bottom, it wasn't that great of a tamale to begin with and charging 5 bucks for one.  Please.  So we also had chicken enchiladas with green sauce.  again nothing to write home about and i feel 2 to 3 bucks more expensive than it should have been. Always wanted to eat here.  Glad its out of my system.  Zappatas on craig is WAY BETTER and much cheaper.

I would pass and prob won't go back.  5 bucks for a  burned tamale.  WTF

The hype for this place is too high. The enchilada cheese tamale was mediocre. I think those bragging about how good the place and the cheese tamale is must have had too many margaritas. Enchilada Cheese tamale was more than $5 and that's for one small tamale. Not worth it. Plates are too expensive for quality. Not a place I'd recommend or come back. $20 for a margarita, a small tamale and small cheese enchilada both a la carte.
Good tamales super good and they are big. I wish the have more vegetables inside but overall great

I come to Dona Maria's for the Menudo and it is delicious.  Unfortunately, this location is almost always empty and the prices keep going up, up, and up...  $3.15 for a soft drink? $4.50 for a tamale? $10.50 for a large bowl of Menudo.

The Tamales and Menudo are very good, but everything else I've tried seems like pretty standard Mexican fare and not very memorable.

I love their chips and salsa!!
We usually go there on Sundays after church for breakfast!!
Service is great also!
My favorite is the Shrimp cocktail;)

This was my first time to Tamales but my mom and grandma who are recent transplants via SoCal (and we know ggod mexican food) eat here on a weekly basis, after tonite I can see why. 

The carnitas are OUTSTANDING.. moist and flavorful, not tough at all. The tamales are possibly the best I have EVER tasted, order them enchilada style with any sauce you like, the green is fab but so is the red and ranchero. When you ask for sour cream you actually get true "crema" which was such a welcomed surprise. The margaritas also pack a punch, go for a pitcher, fab deal for $16. 

The dessert also doesnt dissapoint, the desert tamal is great, the flan is fab and the deep fried ice cream shows that you should only eat corflakes this way.

The service is friendly and fast but not rushing at all. They even brewed a fresh pot of coffee for my grandmother 15 minutes before closing.

This was my frist visit but surely not to be my last. 

Salute!

This place was so good. We got seated right away, the hostess was very pleasant. Then the waiter came and got our drinks. They give free salsa and chips which is delicious.... We ordered nachos and the enchiladas. The nachos have tons of cheese but they were good. The enchilada were great tasting too. Daughters taquitos   were a little overlooked for her liking. The waiter was very attentive and they even gave us to go cups for our drinks. We ordered the deep fried ice cream to go and I suggest you do the same. Overall the place is very good and I would definitely recommend it.

Our favorite go-to mexican restaurant every week! Make sure you ask for Carlos. He is our favorite server!! He's so attentive, friendly and definitely knows what good customer service means.  
Food is amazing as well!

I came here with Ken, Paolo, and Tricia for the Tamales and Brewskis UYE.  I guess I never realized that this was a bonafide full service restaurant.  This location is very spacious.  

They serve a ton of different Mexican food but we were here for the tamales.  You can get one tamale for $4, six tamales for $14.25, and a dozen for $19.95.  Huh? Definitely get a group together and go for the dozen.  They let you mix and match and they are so tasty.  

The drinks here are pretty cheap, too.  $8 for pretty large mixed drinks.  I highly recommend this place for groups.  Or get your tamales to go, and have a party at home!

Over priced and lousy food. 14 bucks for 2 chicken tacos w/rice and beans. The shells were boxed type prefab, the chicken was watery, and the beans and rice were bland. 

Service was very good.
They have really good margaritas for a good price.  I love there chips and salsa, and tamales.  We moved so we are not as close anymore, moss going here as often :(
Fast Quick service. Great foods, Family and friendly environment

I love tamales and these just did nothing for me- very disappointed....there was lack of flavor 
Won't be back

The best Mexican food in town! My husband and I have been going here for 6 years now and we are regulars. They are best known for their tamales, and rightfully so. My favorite is their chicken tamale with green sauce - so delicious! For me, the best item on their menu is the albondigas soup (meatball soup). I am a Mexican restaurant frequenter and I always order the albondigas soup. Dona Maria's is BY FAR the best in town. It's a must order. They also make their own flour tortillas (a must for authentic Mexican food) and they are great. The chips are good and the salsa is a bit "tomatoey" than what I prefer but it's still very good.

The only downside (and the reason for 4 stars instead of 5) is the service can be pretty slow on a regular basis. Be ready for a minimum 45-minute meal anytime you come here to eat. But don't let that deter you, the wait is worth it!

As a white girl with half of her family being Hipanic, I was raised on Mexican food. Sad to say, but this place was so-so......It is up the street from Mountain View Hospital, so while my sweets was in surgery, I suggested this place his family based on Yelp....I failed on this one! The tamales were DRY! The chile colarado taco was super soaked in BAD red sauce (passed it to my sister in law, she said it tasted spoiled!) Chile Relleno's, so sad that is was covered in red sauce, yet the batter was greasy, and tasted like it was fried in old oil.
The only saving grace of this experience was the service, great waiter!
Will I, or my family members come back? NOPE! I'll stay with Macayo's or Pepe's for the good Mexican food!

It's funny.  We've been kicking off our weekends here for nearly 10 years now.  In all that time I had never tried the seafood enchiladas. Shrimp, scallops and octopus in your choice of ranchero or green sauce.  In a word...WOW.  This dish is a little more daring than the rest of their menu and well worth ordering!  Beats my usual bean tacos!

Service was very slow last night. Took a long time to pay the bill. Food was OK. When the cashier asked me how everything was, I told her. She apologized,  said they had some people problems, gave us our drinks for free. She showed she cared. We will come back later some time.

Food and atmosphere is always been good. The big problem is the prices are now ridiculous. Taco and tamale plate for $16? Unfortunately, we are going to need to look for a place a little more reasonable.

I've been hitting Dona Maria's since they were located in a strip mall on 10th & Charleston, around 1981 or so. Over the years, they've delivered consistently decent food, with the tamales being their signature item. Nowadays I don't bother with anything other than the tamales, which I order by the dozen and take home. They're still a bargain at $20. Order the hot salsa, it's much, much better than the regular, which is bland, and watery. The hotter salsa is made with roasted chile's. It's texture and color are well balanced with a fiery kick to the palate.
The service at the Cheyenne location is fair, but nothing special, or outstanding, which is why I just do the take out option these days. Obviously, they're doing something right because I keep going back after all these years. Overall, they're worth a trip because the Summerlin location is around the corner from my house, but only a 3 star place, IMHO.

Dona Maria is pretty close to our house. I've seen a number of good reviews, and I've been wanting to try it for some time. We finally got around to trying it a few weeks ago.

The albondigas soup was pretty decent. The tortilla soup had lots of cheese but not meat. The chips and salsa were average. The chile relleno was good but not the best I've ever had. The guacamole was good but kinda runny. The chicken tamal was decent and the pork tamal was pretty good. The banana margarita was interesting/different. The chicken taco was fine as was the flan. (No, I didn't eat all of this myself. I split it with my wife and we had leftovers.)
Fantastic tamales. We've been looking for authentic tamales since we moved here. Tried pork and chicken and both were fantastic. Also great margaritas at happy hour.  Definitely be back.

Okay, I gave this place the highest review. I have been here a few times before, and have always been very pleased. Last night there was just one thing wrong. It was the blue cheese dressing on the salad. I took two bites and decided not to eat any more. Instead I asked for some meatball soup instead. I have never had meatball soup before. It was okay. My son got the tortilla soup, and he liked that. I got a ground beef enchilada, a cheese enchilada, and a ground beef taco. I got double the amount refried beans because I really like refried beans  a lot, even though I also like mexican rice. I like to eat the beans with the chips. Francisco brought us plenty of drink refills. I was very pleased with the taste of both types of enchiladas, the taco and the refried beans. I made a good selection. The leftovers I took home seemed even better the next day. I was in a good mood and was having an excellent time with my son. I will not fail to come back here again.

I went for lunch and was a bit worried as I walked in. Not ever been here and good authentic Mexican food is hard to find. I ordered a beef tamale and chicken enchilada plate. The tamale was very good soft masa and not skimpy on the meat. The enchilada had good flavor too. The rice was a bit bland. Salsa has a little kick would label it medium but the chips needed salt. The margarita was good and strong. 
My boyfriend ordered a bowl of pozole and it was very good. Very good flavor and spicy and the pork was very tender. 

Service here was good and friendly. I would come back here again.
I bought a dozen beef tamales and they were so delicious.  This was my first time and I will be back.  Yumm....
Doñia Maria's is definitely the place to go if you want tamales. They sell tamales to go as well. Since it says Doñia Maria's Tamales, I tend to order those when I go there !
I always come here for my margaritas!  Even better if it's at happy hour.  I dare you to drink the big one!  My first time!  Strawberry margaritas!

I brought my mom here because she craves posole a lot and this was the closest place to her house LOL. It was a quick lunch and were only there for about an hour before we had to go. We both got posole...it was good, but it was what you made it, you know? It could be basic posole or an amazing kick in the mouth depending on how much lime (lemon in this case), chile, and onion you put in it. Mine was #bomb, Guys. I'm good that way. Anyway, I have no complaints except for the fact that they forgot to bring our drinks out at one point so we gave up on those. The horchata was also good but I didn't understand how a glass of Sprite cost more than the horchata, which some consider a unique drink. Beats me. Anyway, good enough to return if I had no other choice but not good enough that it would be my FIRST choice.

Horrible!!!never again. We decided for tamales and menudo. It was a party of 8 and they said the wait was going to be 45 minutes. We understood since we were a large party. About 30 minutes later they sit us down. They get our drink orders and bring chips. We place our order and then this is where it went to hell. In 30 minutes we had 1 refill on coffee and no status on our food. At 45 minutes of waiting and everyone starving. We decided to hunt down a server. He check on our food and told us we still had 2 parties ahead of us before they start on our food. Mind you this place was not packed, it was average. We decided we were leaving. So I head to the register and ask the hostess to charge me for the drinks. I told her we want to leave because it's taking too damn long for already made tamales and menudo. She tells me the total is $116. WTF!?! I tell her no I'm not paying for the food u guys didn't bring. She states it's already entered so I have to charge you. I tell her no she doesn't because I never receive the food.  We argue back and forth then she states oh well we told u it would be 45 minutes! Yeah u did but 45 minutes to sit down not 45 minutes to get our food (not including the 30 minutes we waited). Our server finally shows up and he was like oh it's not my fault. I don't care who's fault it is, I was not paying for her food. So I demanded to speak to the supervisor... she takes off and comes back a minute later telling me oh he said u can leave and he won't charge you. Oh thanks but I don't need a damn hand out, I would pay what we drank but that's it. She said no he said it's okay. So needless to say we WILL NEVER EVER COME BACK HERE AGAIN!!!!!
They have the best blended Margaritas, tamales and nachos in Vegas! We've been coming here for years. In the winter I can always count on a hot bowl of Posole to warm me up!

This was our first time here. The food was delicious and came out quickly. The pitcher of margaritas is a great deal for 20$, we didn't even finish it, although we ordered mango and there was no mango flavor to be found..still good...very kid friendly, the server was okay. The only complaint is the prices are a bit high for the type of food served. Ultimately you could find better tasting Mexican food for the same price.
Good food! Great customer service. My second time coming and everyone is really nice.

Worst place ever. How can a Mexican feel so out of place at a Mexican restaurant? Food was awful. Chile verde was cold and tasted from a can, chiminga was a hard greasy tortilla full of "meat"?  The waiter ignored us the whole time while he attended to other "white" guest. Our "movie nite" got cancelled because we had to run home because we got shits. Never going back again!

This place is not a five it's a 10 ! You can not beat the tamales here no matter how hard you try. The tamales are stuffed full of juicy meat not all just full of corn meal !im talking stuffed to the max with the best juiciest meat it's unreal !! The green sauce is so good I can drink it down out of a glass. Everything is made in house and all original recipes !!! Amazing just amazing really I can't get enough. Sometimes I just order a dozen to go with a large container of green sauce and take it home. The best Tamales in the world !!!

The tamales are always fresh and made to perfection, if you call at least 10 minutes ahead of time they will be ready for you by the time you arrive.  They have two locations and the are both easy to get to because they are close to the freeway.

My friend's love this place! Wonderful staff, very friendly and helpful. They have margaritas in all sizes....I'm a jumbo gal. Good and somewhat strong...just keep stirring that drink till it tastes like kook-aid. This will not be our last visit here...I'm pretty sure.

Went to lunch today and had the sampler,very dry chicken, if that's what it was, I'm thinking it was cat, totally gross. The chip/ salsa was poor, chips were oily and the salsa was bland, had no flavor. Poor service.

It's been a couple years since we've been here.  Immediately seated & given warm chips & salsa.  Ordered the night's special: 2 pork tamales enchilada style = smothered in red sauce. Wife ordered 2 tamales (1 chicken 1 cheese). Both combo plates came with salad, rice & beans. Pork tamales filling was dry. Wife said chicken with green chili sauce too hot for her. Her original margarita so thick straw stood up by itself & frosted over. My mango margarita was ehhh. Remember having better there. It was just OK.

I ordered take out last weekend and when I called my order in I was told it'd be ready in 20 minutes. I arrive 20 minutes later and was told it'd be a few minutes. Meanwhile I'm waiting for my order when I see the hostess/ cashier packing up bags of chips for take out orders. Well I was disgusted to see she was not wearing gloves, had not washed her hands after several patrons paid for their check. While I've always ordered take out I still think the food is good.

Wife and I decided to try this restaurant based on the reviews. My only guess is reviewers have no idea what real Mexican food is. First off the salsa is heavy tomato with little to no flavor. My wife's margarita was very good as she stated they did not shy away for the tequila. I ordered the Carne Asada and what arrived was a rib eye cut ( with good flavor ) but not Asada. The beans that came with the dish are canned and the rice was bland at best. And one funny thing was all the white customers were placed in the area by the bar. Sure it wasn't done intentionally, but still funny. Sorry to say that this is our last visit as this town has much stronger options for Mexican food.

How this place gets almost 5 stars is beyond me. The Salsa is basically tomato paste and sauce. The chips are store-bought the guacamole taste frozen. 

The octopus and shrimp cocktail is actually really good but the nachos was the worst ever. Lacking any life as a nacho!

The beans and rice looked old and tasted stale. 

Really a poor effort in the kitchen to be maintaining any freshness and standards.

We winged it and stopped in for lunch on a Thursday. Some of the reviews scared us but we decided to try it anyway. We started with large house Margaritas and one each was plenty! Delicious and heavy on the alcohol. The chips and salsa were a 3.5 out of 5. They were good but not amazing. I got the tamale and chili rellano plate and my boyfriend got the tamale and burrito plate. Coming from Northern California and having experienced some amazing mom and pop Mexican places this did not disappoint. Even the rice and beans were amazing. We both took half our plates home because it was so much food.
Get our tamales and champurrado here every year. Not the best I've ever had but they pretty good. The regular menu is pretty good as well.

I have been going to Dona Maria's for about 6 years and I have to say that the quality has been going the wrong direction.  I went there this past week with my parents.  My Mom's cocido had hardly any meat in it.  Also, they were also stingy on the vegetables.  My Dad had tacos and they were ok, but is it just me or does it seem wrong to be red sauce on a ground beef taco? Just saying.

I had the chicken fajitas and I was impressed with the amount of actual chicken in the fajitas.  

The tortillas were exceptional, however I am not sure I want to pay as much as this place costs for stellar torts....

Horrible time at the restaurant yesterday the chimi changa lunch special was cold and the cheese on the beans were just slapped on the plate like a food line.l, and the cheese not melted. I had the shredded taco and a ice cold tamale. The shredded beef had this thick nasty red sauce mixed with it. I told the waiter and asked to have this changed to a plain ground beef taco. When it came out guess what it was mixed in the same gross sauce. 2 lunches and two margarjtas 50 bucks wow. This will be our last time coming here. We used to go twice a month but now were done. Taco bell would of been better than this! What a rip off.

First time I've been a dine in customer. Normally I get the tamales in the take out fashion. But this time, I decided to experience the dine in. Dona Maria's staff is very attentive and always there. The prices are on point for the quality of food. Next time I'm trying the margaritas.

I Used to love this place. Now I hate it! It took them over an hour and 15 minutes to make Mexican dishes! Is this not what they do? The place was not busy and definitely they did not have the right to blame their poor service on the half packed establishment.  We also had to ask for a Manger two times as they could not get a cheese quesadilla right. My son was in tears at this restaurant. He was very hungry and grumpy after the first 40 minutes. We specifically asked for the kids meal first as we always do. Most importantly, It was a new job celebratory party for myself and my son's Grandmother's birthday party. After this I demanded that all drinks be comped plus the kids meal or I would walk. They still only took off half the drinks and the kids meal. 

They did somewhat try to redeem their lack of good service by singing happy birthday to an 83 year old Great Grandmother. Managerial staff decided delivering huge loads of ICE cream to the table and flan or rice type dessert was the ideal way to make good on this overpriced overrated garbage food. I never been more under impressed by a Mexican Restaurant in my entire life. If they had only listened to my requests I would have given them 3 stars at best. Delivering a table full of sweets to a family who is mostly diabetic is ridiculous and uncalled for...it was a total waste cause we all shared one dessert. It literally felt like this staff were so disconnected and weren't even on the same planet as they worked together with no cohesiveness at all. It's a shame this place is so high priced. I literally don't see them keeping their business in this economy. 

Chef Ramsey Where are you when we need you? Kitchen Nightmares shout out.

The food is decent, the service is slow, and the salsa is barely spicy.

Mexican restaurant rundown:
Chips and Salsa: The chips are actually fantastic. They taste fresh baked and have perfect crispiness. The salsa however is rather bland. Basically it lacks any serious spice, and that seems like a crime when paired with these amazing chips.

Food: Decent. Emphasis on the decent. It's unmistakably Mexican, but it lacks any real pop. Nothing exciting, nothing unexpected. The ingredients seem fresh enough, but the result is just okay.

Cerveza: Bonus points for having Negra Modelo and Dos XX Amber on tap.

Service: Slow! Restaurant wasn't even half full and we could barely get a waiter's attention.

Good, not great.
After calling 3 times to place a takeout order and 20 !!! Min on the phone waiting time and then got hung up on we will take our business elsewhere. Horrible customer service

My family ate there and loved the food. That night my brother in law got very sick. We thought that he had the flu. Two days later my husband and I ate there and got terribly sick. We just found out that two of our friends that ate there a few months ago also got sick. Don't think that we'll be going back, ever.

The food lacked flavor,seasoning and was very bland. Ordered the huevos con chorizo plate and it was plain had no spice/no sason latino no madre. The spiciest salsa they had was equivalent to a Taco Bell mild sauce lol 1.75$ for a spoon full  of sour cream smh I'd pay $1.75 for crema Mexicana in a heart beat, the place was nice just hella catered to American culture. Authenticity 0. Business 10. 
Puras fallas con mi gente.
2 stars only because the place looks nice.

I drove past this place the other day and decided to suggest it to a few friends of mine for a casual dinner one night.  A week later, we're all trying to decide on a dinner spot and this came to mind.

First off, this place is HUGE!  From the outside, it looks so tiny, but you walk in and it's just such a big space, with tons of tables, which is good because our wait to get seated wasn't long at all.  The front staff was so nice and when we'd been seated, it wasn't even two minutes later that our waiter came by to get our drink orders and leave the standard chips and salsa for us.

Starting out with the chips and salsa, it was so good!  I usually don't put much stock into this item as I'm of the belief that salsa and chips are such an easy thing to prepare, but I've recently had that theory proven wrong.  For dinner, my friends and I generally like to order two or three full meals and just split everything, give us a chance to try more than one thing from the get-go.  We got the nachos and the enchilada/street taco platter.  Both were so delicious!  They had individual things on each dish that could have been improved, like the nachos had more cheese and chicken on top of the chips rather than dispersed throughout, but it wasn't enough to cloud my judgment of our experience here.

Between the amazing customer service and the delicious food, I intend to go back to this restaurant and try out more of their menu.

Great place to get great, delicious Mexican food. The staff is very nice and they made sure I was taken care of. The food comes in good portions is a great value. The chicken chimichanga was delicious and came with a good portion of beans and rice. Great place to order soup as well. Definitely would come back.

Nasty food. Dirty. Terrible service. They tack on random expenses like if you ask for a little more sour cream for their dry food. They forget about you and don't refill your drinks. Beware of the food. I got sick from there.
Overpriced. Everything is super expensive! Size is pretty small too. Do not recommend.

Seafood enchilada and beef fajitas! True, they use imitation crab in the enchilada, but it's really good anyhow.  The red sauce is great.  This sounds a little odd, but the assistant waiters are super great.  Staff on a whole is excellent.  Chips are a little thick and overfried, but salsa is  favorite in town.  Beef fajitas are super duper fresh and best I've ever had. Even compared to places in L.A.  They were out of homemade flour tortillas one night which was disappointing as I'd brought several people from out of town, but fajitas are so good it didn't much matter.  I like to get extra veggies because they are so flavorful, peppers and onions.  Hope y'all enjoy as much as my li'l group of fans do.  Space is big and welcoming.  Desserts are fun too.

I love their chips and salsa enough it gets two stars all by itself. I have never seen this place busy, yet they have been open for a long time. I have tried there fajitas, enchiladas, tacos, and burritos.. All tasty. I'm not a fan of cacamoule so I ask for all of that stuff without. The prices are reasonable.

Sorry, but this was the worst Mexican restaraunt that I have ever been to.  The salsa had no flavor whatsoever.  The chicken tacos were extremely salty and they had no queso dip!  Just a big disappointment considering that I had 2 friends from out of town with me!

I have had tamales from here a few different times and they were delicious! Unfortunately I picked up a dozen tamales again only this time I was so disappointed. They were very dry, no flavor and I believe they changed the cheese tamales only because last time it was spicy this time it had bell pepper and onion inside. Maybe I ordered wrong but either way all the tamales we're very low quality. I also found chicken bones in a couple tamales and something that looks like PLASTIC!!

I'm giving this place two stars because the prices of the meals were way to over priced, especially for okay food. I got huevos rancheros and... Never again... Hahaah. I will say that the server was very nice though! I got the melon margarita which was delicious, and he let me try the banana margarita too. Soooo I might go back to try the different flavored margaritas which are pricy too, but that's about it.

I've been going to this location since it opened and to the main location in Central Las Vegas for 20+ years. Truly reminds me of my Abuela's cooking. Delicious. Servers remember you and your order. You can't beat that. Love this place.
I had a fabulous bowl of Albondigas!  Reminds me of when my grandmother would make it!  The service was great and very friendly!

What Happened?   Got Greedy!   Tourist Trap Now ...  $51.50 for to go lunch ...
3 Chimichangas & 2 Tamales ....  They nickel & dime you for everything ...  Xtra charges for everything ....   What a Rip!     ADIOS ... LOCALS WON'T  BE BACK HERE!

Initially I was surprised that Dona Maria's didn't receive rave reviews. My family has been coming here for years. Dona Maria's is our go-to for family functions, actually. We have had many graduation, birthday, and even going away dinners here. However, after a recent experience my mom and I had, I'm not shocked that they don't have the best rating. 
The restaurant was empty (as usual; I don't think I've ever seen them busy) and we were seated quickly. Francisco was our server and he came to our table exactly twice; to take our order and to bring us our food. He has a bad attitude and acts like you are really putting him out if you ask for anything. Our drinks were empty the majority of the time, and my Mom had to wave him down to ask for our check and to-go order despite the fact that we were clearly done with the meal and had been for a while. So why four stars despite the service? Because when we went to pay, we were given 20% off to rectify the situation. We were also advised to ask not to be seated in his section again. It's pretty bad when a member of your own staff won't recommend you. The food is good, but make sure you ask to be seated in Eloy's section. He's the best and always remembers our family and even our usual orders. I no longer have to ask for a side of sour cream because Eloy knows.
This is a have to every time we come to Vegas. Outstanding tamales in my opinion. Bonus because we can get them to go for the trip home.

By far The worst mexican place I've ever been to , my girlfriend and I came to this place thinking that since they have a name like tamales that they would specialize in tamales but no! We were very wrong , this place is far from authentic mexican food or even tamales at that , the tamales taste like they came frozen and they warmed them up in the microwave , kinda like the salsa they brought us out with chips , that's right guys frozen salsa kinda like a slushee but with chunks of frozen ice !, when I asked the waiter if I could have some salsa that wasn't frozen he said " all of our salsa comes from the same bucket so most likely it still going to be frozen, but if you want I can stick it in the microwave ", I couldn't believe the terrible customer service we received , and the food,  I ordered the chicken burrito with a chicken enchilada and a chicken tamal and it was all flavorless and dry , and to top it off extremely over priced , this was by far the worst mexican restaurant I've ever been to . I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone looking for some authentic Mexican food , don't waste your money here folks , have a wonderful evening
Ordered the carne asada, dry, couldn't chew it neither could my comrades. I will never be coming back here

I love this place! I go here at least once every few weeks for their Mexican breakfast (Chilaquiles is my favorite). The food is always prepared fresh and most mornings you can see the owners there making the food themselves. I love the family feel and the relaxed and friendly atmosphere! I take all my out-of-town friends here for real home-made Mexican food! Highly recommend!
Best carnitas ever!  I could eat those everyday.  Go try them as soon as you can.  Restaurant is clean and the service is good but the carnitas will knock your socks off.

Omg! What is that smell?! The last 2 times we went there it smells like a sewer pipe broke under the restaurant!  We actually left the second time, the moment we walked through the door!  The first time was a month before and they hadn't fixed this?! It's like eating in a dirty toilet!  Won't be back and it's a shame because their food is good!

Best tamales in town very nice and moist the pork is so tender and flavorful. The salsa isn't the most flavorful but we weren't there for that so we added some salt and some lime from the beers and it fixed it right up. Already been here a few times. Always good to go on the night when they have the 2 tamale enchilada style for the special especially during happy hour! Love it!

Dona Maria Tamales Restaurant has been a local family owned business in Vegas for over 30 years. I ate here a few times growing up and didn't like it so when a friend suggested that hubby and I meet for dinner here I was hesitant, but figured why not give it another shot after so long. 

We were seated next to the bar (bar was dead) and service was very good. We were started off with the usual suspects... Chips & salsa. The chips were good however the salsa had no kick at all and was very sweet, almost like it was just a can of thinned tomato paste. Gross! 

All dinners are served with a soup or salad. I chose the "Tortilla Soup" and it actually didn't taste bad. I ordered the #29 "Taco and Enchilada" priced at $13.50 plus an additional $2.15 because I wanted carnitas in my taco. The beans and rice that accompanied my meal were either under a heat lamp for too long or reheated. The beans were crunchy and hard around the edges and the had no good flavor. The rice was pretty much the same. The green sauce on my enchilada had great flavor it was just that the enchilada itself wasn't that great. It was edible, but the tortilla was stiff. The carnitas had good flavor, but again I wasn't crazy about the tortilla. Our friend ordered the #14 "Chile Relleno and Enchilada" priced at $13.50 and they thought it was decent. Hubby ordered the #27 "Fajitas Dona Maria" (beef) priced at $14.75 and said that he's had better.

I wanted to try the "Churros" priced at $5.50 for dessert. It was presented well, but all of the cinnamon sugar was on the plate not on the churros. These churros were very dry and not worth a penny. 

Though I have no plans to purposely come back here, I did give it 2 stars because the service really was very good and I did enjoy my soup. I believe they try hard to do something good here at Dona Maria Tamales Restaurant, it just isn't good enough for me.

They claim to be knows for their "Tamales" and even though I haven't tried them here, I have heard from people that they are worth picking up. Prices are $3.95 each, $14.25 for a half dozen, and $19.25 for a dozen. They offer the following tamales:

Red - pulled pork in a mild sauce
Green - shredded chicken in hot sauce
Cheese - monterrey jack, green chilies and onions
Sweet - pineapple and raisins ($3.30 each)

I'm giving 2 stars because of pricing. The food was not bad, but in no way was worth the price!  I ordered the two enchilada and taco plate. $17. They up charged me an extra $2.35 to have carnitas in my taco. (Isn't pork cheaper than beef or chicken? ) when I found out this almost $20 meal didn't come with sour cream...I asked for a side for $3 extra.  BIG MISTAKE!  it came in a small 50 cent plastic cup and it wasn't even real sour cream! It was some gross liquid crap. I didn't even eat it. Biggest waste of $3 ever!   I just can't recommend this place because it's a huge waste of money.  You can get the same food for 1/2 the price somewhere else.

Been coming here for over a year prices have gone up and service has gone down. 
 Overall decent food but once they bring you food the server doesn't come back. Disappointing to say the least.

We just moved walking distance from here and decided we would give it a try. We brought our two kids with us. The restraunt was very clean with a lot of seating. We were given a table right away. The food was beyond my expectations! Great margaritas and salsa to start. My hubby and I ordered carne Asada tacos and shrimp fajitas to share. The fajitas came with homemade tortillas that were so delicious! The tacos were also very, very good. The kid's meals were pretty expensive, $8.95 I think. My son wanted a bean and cheese burrito and the al a carte was the same price as the kids meal. We were told the kids meal comes with rice and beans but he doesn't really need beans on the side when it is already in his burrito. We ordered him the adult size. We definitely will going back for the large margaritas, tacos and amazing tortillas!

I love Mexican food and this place delivers. From the outside it does not look like much but on the inside it is very well decorated and has super tall ceilings. They even have a tortilla making machine which might be cool for the kids.. High ratings on chips and salsa and the enchiladas. Found the tamales a bit dry. Good service.

If you LOVE cilantro and food that is just barely warm, then this place is for you!   We ordered #12 a burrito, an enchilada and a tamale (the tamale because the place is named after tamales and supposedly has great tamales).  Hubby ordered #24 Chimichanga and tamale.  We ordered chicken for everything since we had read reviews about "chewy" beef and pork.  The dinners came with soup and we got the tortilla soup.  The salsa that comes with the chips at the beginning of the meal was spicy, yet it had so much cilantro in it that it was unpleasant to eat. The soup looked good, but it was tepid room temperature when it arrived at our table.  YUCK.  Our meals when they arrived were also just warm, not hot.  First thing we tried after our meals arrived were the tamales since this was their specialty.  Both of us thought the chicken tamales were "boring".  No pizzazz.  I have had much better tamales at many many other Mexican restaurants.  The rice that came with the dinners was very spicy, but not enough to make up for the heavy cilantro flavor of everything else.  Additionally, the prices of the food on the menu were a bit steep for the quality of food we got.  We won't bother going back.
I'm a vegetarian and they were super accommodating to my dietary needs. We got margaritas and they were delicious!

My 1st time here and the food tasted good, I do think it is a little over priced for tacos and burritos. The service was good the wait staff were very attentive with making sure everything was okay and if we needed refills. The tamles were good and filled with alot of meat and the masa was very tasty.
We are giving this restaurant 5 Stars and our server Eloy 5 stars! He was incredibly helpful and pleasant. Mango margaritas here are the bomb!

I love coming here for dinner.  The food and the service is excellent and fast!  They start you off with chips and very tasty salsa.  I usually order a bowl of pozole (excellent) and pork tamales (so yummy).  Prices are very decent, everyone is very friendly, margaritas are nice and strong!  The dining area itself is huge, so there really is no wait for a table.  I believe they have happy hour from 4-6pm daily.
Service was a bit slow, food wasn't so great either. Chips and salsa wasn't good at all, more like a tomato sauce.
First time here, but food was served cold. Had to send soup back to be reheated. Fajitas came out warm, but not very hot. Rice & beans were luke warm. We will not return.

Dona Maria is in my neighborhood, so we eat here every once in a while (3-4 times per year).  They're known for their Tamales here.  If I was to rate this place just on the Tamales, I'd give them 4 Stars.  However, since they aren't, they only get 3 Stars.  Here's why:

- Their Chips & Salsa is not that great.  The Chips are inconsistent....sometimes they're fresh and taste good, sometimes they're greasy and taste stale.  The Salsa is very weak and bland in my opinion.....no option for Spicy Salsa either.

- Nachos and Beef Fajitas are my entrees of choice here.  Both are just OK, not great.  It fills my tummy, but it doesn't leave me wanting more.

The family enjoys coming here because it's close to home.  If it were up to me, I'd pass on it most days.

Return Factor - 50%

We used to really love this place their food was still good but their prices were to the top everything was all a cart they give you small sides for large prices for one person's pay-round about $19-$20 just not worth it and the service was lacking very much

Dona Maria deserves an update.  I finally tried the cheese tamale cooked enchilada style, and wow is it delicious!  Every future visit will be for the sole purpose of obtaining this hot cheesy tasty goodness.

I'm a huge fan of Dona Maria, they never let me down! The food is great and the atmosphere is casual. Theres never a long wait for food and the wait staff is tops. There are always plenty of people around to help serve you. I don't venture far into mexican cuisine and tend to order the same selections. I would recommend the chile rellenos and the enchiladas. I have yet to try their namesake tamales. I would steer clear of the burritos has they tend to be on the dry/boring side for mexican food.

Dona Marias on Tenaya has been a family favorite of ours for years. My kids love the soup and the fresh made tortillas. They are a little pricey so it is a sometimes treat. (Like once a week if I can bribe my wife into it with a grande Midori Margarita on the rocks)

I highly recommend their grande margaritas. They are bueno-tastic!.
This place is over priced and food is not very good at all. Didn't even ask how I wanted my steak cooked. Thumbs down. Casa don juans down the road is wayyyyy better.

First time eating food from this restaurant. Ordered tamales for pick up for a group of us. We had cheese, chicken and pork tamales. None of them were any good unfortunately. Very soggy. The staff was friendly.

My parents enjoy Mexican food and when they visit us we go here now that Viva Mercados closed.

Their tamales are decent, but I think the place is a little overpriced and the margaritas and rest of the food are just okay.  But I must admit I have yet to find a better Mexican restaurant in the valley.  I have many favorites in my hometown of San Diego that would blow this place away, but I am not traveling 8 hours for a Mexican dinner out.

Yummy chips and salsa

Five star flavored lunch and service

Today's special...Chile Colorado and its yummy!

Mmmmm! Cheese enchiladas!

Great Margaritas order cheese tamale!

Order the cheese tamales! Green Chile Plate Special for St. Pattys Day! Chips and salsa the best!!

Love the tamales, order them to go by the dozens. Restaurant is always too crowded and too noisy for me to dine in. Blame it on acoustics. Bothers me even when waiting to pick up my tamales....... Worth it though.

The food here is actually pretty good. The service is also pretty solid. It's really unsettling to me to only give this place 2 stars, but I'm forced to do so because of the condition of the restrooms. The rest rooms always look and smell disgusting. I like to wash my hands before each meal and every time I come here I end up losing my appetite after going in their restrooms. They never have soap and their paper towels seem to be very very cheap.

I had to edit my review and drop another star as I was messaged by personnel of this establishment stating something about a sales call??? I'm appalled that it got to this level. A businesses main concern should be the satisfaction of a customer (in my case a customer who used to frequent this place often and always preferred Miguel the waiter for his diligent professionalism) not the justification and first assumption that is irrelevant to my reviews.
Over priced for what you get. I was expecting good chicken tamales from here, only to be let down. Masa and chicken had no flavor what so ever. The service here was okay but nothing memorable.

We went here on a recommendation. Let me tell you don't even waste your time going here service was like McDonald's we were seated and waited over ten minutes to get our drinks or even see a server. Food was ok if you like wet watered down salad and boiled tasteless chicken. The only thing that tasted some what good was just the chips the salsa was so gross and tasteless also. We went with family and my mother ordered a chicken quesadilla but when it came to the table it was cheese sent it back it it took a whole 20 minutes for them to make it and send it back out although they made it right and took it off our bill we never seen a manager.

I should have read the yelp warnings. The chips were pieces and the salsa was runny and not very flavorful. I had the small chimichanga with a side of rice. The plate came out burning hot, but the rice was luke warm. The chimichanga was good maybe a little more cheese. Very pricey for the mediocre food. Four meals for $80 with the tip. We won't be back.

Unfortunately, Chapala's was closed the day after Thanksgiving, so we ended up here as a plan B.

5 stars for the $4.95 grande margarita during happy hour, which was also honored in the dining room!!! That's the one and only redeeming quality about this place.

Chips and salsa: Standard, slightly greasy chips. Tomato based salsa with not much flavor or heat.

Dinner: Ordered the #29 combination (taco, enchilada, rice and beans with a green salad.) 

Green salad: Not saying much, but best part of the meal. How can you really mess up lettuce, cheese and ranch dressing?

Cheese enchilada: Overcooked tough and crispy tortilla. Enchilada sauce was bland

Shredded beef taco: As Clara Peller would say, "Where's the BEEF?"  Not much to this taco at all and what little meat was in there, was the consistency of baby food.

Rice:  Dry and flavorless

Beans: Impossible to review, since there were only two teaspoons at most on the plate.

Value for the money: Non-existent. $13 for the combo and I left hungry.

The only reason I would come back here is for happy hour, then hit a Roberto's Taco Shop or Dimas Tacos afterwards!
