FINALLY I found a Mexican restaurant in Vegas worth a repeat visit.  I super lucked out since it's right around the corner from our house..  The place is HUGE inside and very welcoming.  The walls are hand painted murals and it's bright and airy.  We were greeted immediately upon entering and were seated within seconds.

Right after that our drink orders were taken and the homemade salsa arrived with excellent chips.  YUM

I actually came in to try their tamales, but when I saw mole on the menu I changed my mind and I am SO HAPPY I did.  I rate restaurants based on their Mole and this place is up there with the best I have ever had.  The chicken mole enchiladas were E X C E L L E N T.  The mole was so perfectly balanced, some chefs make it a little too bitter and this was none of that.  My writing this I realize I need to go back soon.
Hubby had the fajitas burrito with changes, he added shrimp to his and deleted the beans.  He never spoke through the entire meal, I think he just made moaning sounds.. LOLOL  funny to watch.  He asked for the spiciest sauce they had and they brought out another homemade salsa that was really good.  I tasted it and although extremely spicy it had great flavor to it.  Too spicy for me, but hubby was in heaven.

My only complaint is that I asked to have the rice omitted from my plate and when it came out there was a full portion of rice.  Since I didn't ask for anything to replace it I didn't mention it to the waiter, by serving it to me it was already wasted.  In their defense I ask for no rice 100% of the time in Mexican restaurants and 98% of the time it still comes out with rice.  I think the cooks are so conditioned in how a finished plate looks that they just do it automatically.

On every trip we take to Vegas I have tried a few Mexican places in hopes of finding a regular hangout for us.  I can't go a week without having some really good Mexican food and now I can honestly say my mission has been accomplished.

I stopped by on July 4th for some lunch and a margaritta. Service was fast and friendly. Margarittas were loaded with taquilla. The salsa, while heavy on the tomatoe, was also spicy. The chips were fresh and warm. My meal, a taco and tamale, went down fast. The shredded beef in the taco was soupy but full of flavor. There was a bit of guacamole on there too. That is never a bad thing. The chicken tamale was still wrapped in its husk and had no sauce. This was perfect for me. I usually scrape the sauce off a tamale anyhow. Did I mention it had a ton of chicken? Not too much massa to worry about with this one. I can see why they are famous for their tamales.
Nice big restaurant.  Our server was great.  Great fresh chips and salsa.  Food was hot and delicious.  Tortillas tasted like they were made in house.

This Mexican Restaurant is Very Very Very Good 
1. The Staff there is always friendly nice and courteous waiter (Miguel is very nice) . We always ask for him .
2. Tamales are Excellent pork, cheese , chicken
3. Prices a little high but the food is worth it . Portions are enough to save for lunch the next day . Now if you go on Sunday for the most part they have a tamale special TWO tamales rice and beans for $9.95
( 4 cuz price a little high )
I highly recommend this restaurant for the flavorful food and stuff!!!!!

Disappointing. Came for the homemade tortillas and they had run out. What good Mexican restaurant runs out of homemade tortillas?!? Actually, a good Mexican restaurant only serves homemade tortillas. The carnitas burrito was mediocre and had to wait more than once to get our water glasses refilled. Wouldn't waste my money here again...it wasn't cheap and it was very average food.

Don't have anything bad to say about this place. The staff is always friendly, the food is consistently good, and the prices are reasonable. I like the option to buy a dozen tamales for a deal price, rather than a bunch of individuals. The shredded beef ones are my favorite. Also really appreciate their knowledge of needing gluten free accommodations. Overall nice restaurant

Have been here several times and have done take out a few times as well. This place is known for their Tamales and that's the best thing here by far. Always moist with good proportion of masa and filling. My favorites are the Pork. The rest of their food is OK, above average Mexican fare.

As always, the food was excellent. We all had Tamale specials, enchilada style. The chicken/ green chili and pork with Red sauce was wonderful. A lot of restaurants makes their tamales with really thick masa with very little filling. Dona Maria's are perfect!

This wasn't bad, but far from the best Mexican food that I have had.

You will note that when you drive in, the place is called the Dona Maria Center. This is because the center is owned by the good folks that founded the restaurant. There in lies the problem.

The restaurant was so successful, that it forgot its roots. 

I ordered a special Tamale, Chile Relano, and Shredded Beef Taco. I ordered Ala carte, so as to get what I want and skip the rice and beans.

The Tamale was good, Chile Relano was fair, and Shredded Beef Taco, maybe a cut above Del Taco, but lacked authenticity. Agree with my fellow reviewer that chips and salsa were not really good.

Mira V. is right that Service was slow, and once again, I think we were paying for the owner's real estate investment. 

I lived nearby for ten years before I tried this place. Now I know why, and no return visit. 

Overpriced, very Gringo. Find a hole in the wall. Save money and get a better meal.
I've been coming here for as long as I can remember and the food is consistently delicious. From the tamales they are known for to their burgers, the food never disappoints.

Ohhh I love you! Dona Maria's is simply the best. Before I moved (now I'm back in Vegas) we would go to happy hour every Friday. Their margaritas are delicious, huge, & STRONG! I have never had a bad meal or bad customer service. This place has been around forever and it is easy to see why!
If you ask, they will bring salsa that is spicier than what comes standard. It is very good. Three ablondigas is a great starter.

Pitcher strawberry margaritas. I needn't say more, but I'll continue anyway. 

Sorry, I'm not a Mexican food afficionado, but my mouth knows what it likes. 

I have this modified diet, so its kind of hard to find options in the way of poultryless and hoovedless options. Crab tacos at Dona Maria's are fantabulous, though. Portions are American-sized and everything tastes like a Mexican heaven. 

* off the strip, non-casino

I have eaten here 2 times. The tamales are incredibly consist ant. 

The beef ones are good and super moist, they didn't use enough guarjillo chiles in the beef mariade in my humble opinion. .. 

The cheese ta males however are next level amazing! Seriously! Super cheesy with great sauce and always juicy.

The prices are weird. They charge too much for some things like a single tamale. On the other hand they only charge 22$ for a dozen though. Its 4 something for 1 by the way. 

I recommend getting a dozen and getting all of them cheese except for 1. Get the sweet one for dessert. Yum.

It was my first time going to this establishment i really was craving Tamales since i enjoy them so much o stoped by to pick up a dozen on my way home and sadly when i got home i realized they were all undercooked.  I had to dispose of all of them.  I will never come back to this place me and my husband usually go to Leticia's at trivoli there prices are great they have excellent food the service is awsome and great margaritas!

I'd been here a few years ago and didn't really care for it.  However, my hubby and I were invited to a party here the other night so we went back.
  The first thing we both noticed was that they seemed a bit pricey for a Mexican place.
  The menu was unimpressive.  
  While our busboy was quick and attentive our waiter was not.  And it was not busy at the time.
  Our food was just ok.  Neither of us were thrilled with our meals.  Hubby thinks the tamales at Trader Joe's are better!   
  Our waiter brought our check over and never even asked us if we wanted dessert.
  We don't ever plan on returning to Dona Maria's, and we can't understand how they stay in business with so many other Mexican restaurants in town that are so much better.

By far the best mexican food in Las Vegas, I've been coming here since 1998 and still go at least once a month, we get treated like family even when their slammed busy. 1 drink will put you on your ass, great service and amazing flavor. love their tamles yummm!!!

This was the fourth and last time I will try this place, I keep thinking it's going to get better and it doesn't, the service isn't attentive and doesn't get orders correctly, the guacamole is more of a guacamole paste in a bowl! I like fresh guacamole! made at your table made to order! I'm not looking to slam them, by no means, I'm sure there's people out there that enjoy it,  but I rather go to Roberto's.
Always good food! Best service and great tamales. And I'm typically not a fan of tamales.
I've eaten here once they have good food but I think there prices are WAY to high for mexican food, you can eat on the strip at a NICE Mexican restaurant for the same price

Let me preface with saying that my husband and I have been coming here since 2009 and have always loved it. Tonight made us decide to never go again.  My husband ordered a burrito and when he noticed they gave him the wrong order, we had to tell another waiter because our waiter never bothered to look at us. When he got his burrito, he was almost half way through when he noticed a long black hair in it. When the waiter finally came around and we told him,  he literally said,  "That's odd. No one in the kitchen had hair like that."  He never once apologized.  When we got to the counter,  the lady was really nice and apologized. She asked if the waiter took my husband's order off the bill and was surprised when we said no. My husband even joked when he sent his order back saying how they'd do something to his food.  I guess he was right.  :( Looks like I'll never be going there again. Go to the one downtown instead if you want good service.  It's the original anyways.

It's called Dona Maria Tamales Restaurant for a reason. They serve some pretty good tamales. We did a take out order for a whole bunch of tamales and everyone in our party liked them very much. Food in their restaurant is pretty good too. In short, they serve some pretty authentic Mexican food that I feel very comfortable recommending to anyone.

I had trouble trying to figure out what to rate this place. I liked service and the atmosphere. Our server was amazing, but the food was just ok. A little bland in some places, but honestly the atmosphere and service makeup for the lack of seasoning, in my opinion. It wasn't the best Mexican I've ever had, but it wasn't the worst either.

Doña Maria's make the best Tamales in Las Vegas hands down. Been here many times over the years and a few times at the downtown location and have yet to ever be let down. The Tamales are always fresh and firm unlike a lot of place they are rock hard and dried out.

I've been coming here for years.  I usually order from the a la carte menu and skip the rice and beans.  The service is consistently good, as is the food.  It's not the most delicious Mexican food I've tasted, but it gets the job done.  My one complaint is the ambiance.  The restaurant feels almost cafeteria-like in its setting as almost all the tables and booths are located in one large area rather than partitioned off like in other places.  It can get fairly noisy, and doesn't have much of a cozy/private atmosphere.

The kids were starving and wanted some Mexican food, and we were right there, so we decided to give Dona Maria another try. We could have gone to Roberto's and been much, much happier.

I have no idea has this place has any favorable ratings. We ordered four entrees and none of them were any good at all. I hate to be brutal here, but it just plain sucked. The one bright spot would be the abondigas soup that was ok. Green enchiladas, chicken mole, even the arroz y frijoles weren't any good. My wife is never a complainer about food, but she couldn't even eat the green enchiladas with chicken. The green sauce was way too salty and the chicken was overcooked to the point of being cat food.

I am a huge supporter of family businesses, but I would advise you to steer clear of this place.

I've driven by the place multiple times and am glad I finally got to check it out. 

The menu is typical of what you can expect at most Mexican restaurants.  

The service was good and the food was just all right. 

I'd definitely go back and try it again.

This is an unexpectedly large Mexican restaurant in the northwest part of town. For some reason, I get that authentic vibe that is hard to manufacture. It's a nicely architected and decorated restaurant.

I was here one night thanks to Ken M and his creative UYEs. This time, it was Tamales and Brewskies. Dona Maria, of course, was the tamales side of that equation. Not wanting to mess around, we decided to order a dozen tamales. Then again, why wouldn't you? It's certainly the cheapest option. I don't remember the exact price points, but it's something like $5 for a single tamale versus about $3 each if you buy a dozen.

There are four tamales to choose from - red, green, cheese, and sweet. The red is pork, the green is chicken, the cheese is cheese (imagine that), and the sweet is pineapple and raisins. I actually enjoyed them all.

I wasn't that hungry on this night, so that was all I had. I'm glad I was with a group and was able to sample all of Dona Maria's tamale offerings. It is called Dona Maria Tamales after all.

We went during lunch so it wasn't crowded. The atmosphere is nice and it's super
Spacious- they have 2 areas of seating. I decided on the burrito lunch with rice
And beans, my mom got the torta, and my sister got the chille rilleno. Everyone was happy with their meal except for me. The burrito was shredded beef and beans, the plate was so hot it burned my arm and the burrito was dry. My moms torta was amazing, I'd def go back for that but I was bummed mine was such a downfall. I drank so much water and basically ate most of the chips instead. The least they could do is add sour cream or a salad on the side to make it more juicy.

Came here on a Tuesday night.......NOT A SOUL IN THE PLACE AT DINNER TIME....5:30PM....Our server was nice enough and came right to the table.....I brought my dad...his mouth about hit the floor when he saw the prices....$4.50 a tamale? Average plate cost almost $18.00 for an item or two with rice and beans? We order and my dad is from a place where mexican food is proud.....Pueblo Colorado.....The plates come....average size and amounts. He as I are extremely dissappointed. We both agree the food better be fabolous.......SORRY.....average at best...he has the chorizo burrito and I have the tamale/taco plate....My tamale was decent, however my taco was very dark and beef flavor overload like the meat was burnt. The beans and rice were decent, but no different than Robertos taco shop.....My dads burrito on the other hand...YUCK......very dry, bland, no flavor.......for 10 bucks for the tortilla filled with chorizo meat, he was disguisted...no frills or thrills in the slighest......At least the bus boy made sure our drinks was filled. The ambiance didnt seem like a mexican restaurant, more like a 80s coffee shop....tons of space and nothing spectacular. the check came.....$40.00 motherfucking dollars for 2...holy shit batman....for that price this place better be on the food channel somewhere. for what you pay for at this place you get about the same mexican food my Italian wife would cook....will never return....good try though.

A friend and I were going to go to Garduno's for lunch, but when we got to Texas Station, we saw a sign that reminded her it was only open for dinner!  Total bummer.  

We wanted to have some really great Mexican food for lunch but weren't sure of another good restaurant in the Northwest.  I'm still relatively new to town (as far as going out is concerned).  I was trying to install the Yelp app on my phone but it wouldn't install, and my phone died before I could find another good place nearby.  

So we decided we would try Dona Maria Tamales.  The salsa seemed fresh and was really flavorful - it had a nice bit of spice to it, too.  (It always gives me a good impression when the chips and salsa are good so I was looking forward to our lunch.) 

I ordered the two tamale lunch (one pork with red sauce and one cheese with green chiles) and a tea.  My friend ordered the enchilada lunch with a chile relleno and a pink lemonade.  Our server was timely and polite for the most part, even though for a while during my lunch I had to wait for more tea before I was able to finish my food.

Apparently there was supposed to be some sauce on my tamales?  (Is that a fact?)  Well, there wasn't any, and they tasted pretty bland.  I was disappointed because my "cheese and green chile" tamale had chicken in it and no green chiles to be found - it was literally flavorless and generally unpalatable.  The "red pork" tamale just had pork in it - where was the red sauce, filler, simmer sauce, where was "red" anything?

My friend said she was less than impressed with her enchilada and chile relleno.  She let me have a bite of her chile relleno and it tasted about 20x better than my tamales - lucky her!  I ended up dumping half of the container of salsa on my tamales, and that barely helped.  The rice and beans were just standard fare - refried beans with some cheese on top and kind of tomatoey rice.  (I really don't like stewed tomato flavor anything). 

Anyway, if you get the tamales without the sauce, or the "green chile" cheese tamale without green chiles and some random chicken in it you didn't ask for or really enjoy, and you have the time (unfortunately today I didn't) - send 'em back if they'll let you and get something else! Maybe some of the seafood dishes here or dinner courses are better, I haven't tried them, but with our experience today, it isn't likely that either of us will return any time soon.

Nice place. Good chips & salsa plus fast, efficient, and friendly service. I had the taco, enchilada, and tamal combination for lunch. Everything was cooked perfectly and presented well. I'll definitely be back for more tamales.

Came her during lunch, they sat us immediately and I felt that as soon as we ordered we where already receiving our food! Wow! The service was great and the chips and salsa where tasty. We ordered the special with two tamales in enchilada sauce, so delicious. Didn't even realize we had finished the entire thing. Definitely recommend.

5 star service from our waiter Chuy!! We have been coming to this location for over 10 years and its the service that really brings us back, EVERY time! He makes the meal so much nicer for sure. He truly is the best!!

We really enjoyed our dinner. We had everything from Nachos ( our shared appetizer), Chimichangas , Fajitas, Burritos and Tacos. The refried beans and rice were so good. This meal was so fresh you could taste it for sure. Everyone's food was hot and delicious. Portions were nice and we left full. :)

If you are looking for a great Mexican restaurant, that is friendly to sensitive tummies, and where the food isn't too spicy. I believe it's more Mexican/American food. I definitely recommend this location. Absolutely delicious and worth every penny! Yummers! Enjoy :)
Great food and service. My family and I go every chance we get. We love the breakfast  burritos and the chicken tamales .
Food is always good. Service is pleasant. Tonight our waiter helped with a short Spanish lesson :-) we loved that ! BEST Cadillac margarita ever!!!!
Excellent food great taste on the  Tamales but unfortunately  I found a hair on my salsa!  Very disappointed as this place looks very clean.

Literally the WORST Mexican food I've had in my entire life. The food was swimming in a pile of grease and I literally vomited in my plate and the manager still made me pay for this slop! My son got sick as well. 

I emailed the owner for a refund which I did not receive but should have called the health department instead! 

THIS PLACE IS ON THE BEST OF LAS VEGAS?!#$%*&

Honestly this restaurant is not impressive. The ambiance is a bit loud and the booth seats are not that comfortable. When we were seated, they came out to give us chips and salsa which were pretty good. My side dish was tortilla soup which I enjoyed more than my entree. I ordered chicken mole enchiladas, which I was not a fan of. It was too chocolaty for my taste.

Service was great food no flavor! Had chicken chim and all that was it the dang thing was a pound of shred chicken ,no pico,no cheese,no sauce,nothing but chicken beans were good rice not so worse food and I think ingot food poisoning also stay away! Roberto's is so better

Great Mexican Food!
They have a Big Menu, including fresh made Tamales and Breakfast!

The prices a little higher, but you get full service, and you get what you pay for.
Portions are generous! I couldn't finish my meal - and I'm a big guy.

They always start you with Fresh 'out of the oven' Chips & Salsa - which is Awesome! 
I enjoyed the Chicken Burrito served enchilada style, with green sauce.
My bride had the Chile Relleno dish with a Taco.
Both were Really Good!
The only negative was the Taco. We were expecting a 'East-Side' street style Taco, but got a pre-formed shell stuffed with the goods. 
Would have been 5 stars, but the taco dropped them to 4 star.

I have been here a couple times, always for (work) lunch, and this time was just as good as my other visits.

I will been coming back again, and I would recommend it to my friends.
There's lots of seating and Full Bar.  Margaritas...
Just skip the tacos - go for the more exotic items, you'll be happy.

The service has always been top notch.  At this point, we've dined here so often it's like visiting with family.  I love their Cocido soup, homemade flour tortillas, fajitas, and chile relleno with Ranchero sauce.  The ranchero sauce is good on anything and everything!  Fajitas always come out sizzling and delicious.  Atmosphere is festive and there are two separate spacious dining areas; one features the bar and the other space is even larger which is perfect for parties.  I prefer sitting in the dining area by the bar.  I can watch the t.v. or see a view of the kitchen.  Sometimes we are there in the evening when they are making the flour tortillas.  it's become a tradition to order their tamales for Christmas.
First time eating here, take out. Delicious food, fresh, warm and very tasty. Definitely one of my favorite places for Mexican food. Thank you

No me gusta!

Late dinner this evening with my friends and I'm unpleasantly surprised by my bland meal. I absolutely love and have eaten tamales from here plenty of times; however my fajitas de Cameron $22+ was underwhelming. No flavor what so ever and the rice and beans were equally disappointing. Side note my banana margarita $12 was amazing! 
The tamales are worth ordering again to go in the near future the rest is to be determined...

Passed the restaurant many times before. Decided to try it as I had recently eaten at the original Dona Maria in the old part of Las Vegas. They have a special offer for $12.95,
The New place was priced higher, it see to me. Lunch for two with dessert was $41.50 with tip. I would go back as this is the best restaurant in the area. Clean, modern and excellent service.
The prices are much higher than I was expecting and the "best tamales" were mushy, watery, and unimpressive. The chimichanga was good, but all around the food wasn't worth the price.

First off the service was excellent. They were very welcoming at the door and the servers were quick and friendly. They were great with refilling my wife's WATER (but they did not offer to refill my 1/2 full soda).  The soda costs $3.10; seems a little ridiculous not to even be asked for a refill on such an expensive soda. I agree with most reviews about the chips and salsa-not good at all; tasted store bought. We both ordered their famous tamales with beans/rice sides. Pork tamales lacked flavor and spice. The chicken was ok, but nothing to write home about-again could have had more flavor. The cheese tamal was unfortunate: although it was the most flavorful, I have no idea what kind of cheese was in it. The cheese was a solid block and very difficult to cut with fork. As it was in the tamal, the cheese is sitting like a rock in my stomach. Bland beans and rice. 

Overall, service was good. Food was ... Eh.... Price was too expensive, especially for lunch and especially given food quality. I was wavering an would almost give 2 stars, but the $3.10 soda was outrageous. So 1 star it is. Would not recommend. Would not go again.

I don't think I know anyone that hates Dona Maria's.
And if I do, chances are I don't like them anyway.

This place has been around for years, and the quality has always been consistent. I used to come here with my family a lot when I was younger, and every now and then I come back around for the nostalgia.

There's great artwork painted on the walls, and the whole place is decorated, though it's nothing too over the top. There's lots of seating, so it's perfect for large groups. It's never too crowded in here when I come, so chances are the wait is rarely long. The bar doesn't seem like it's open anymore, but there's a seating area off to the side if you want to see the TVs. 

My favorite thing on the menu is the lunch combos, you can combine any of the two or three: tacos, tamales, enchiladas, etc. and you get a side of beans and rice. They come as the standard shredded beef, chicken, or cheese. The beef tacos are the best thing, I seem to get them every time, no matter how many times I tell myself to try something new.
For dessert, the flan is always the go-to for me, but they also have this crazy churro wheel that's served with whip cream and is amazing.

The service has always been very nice here, and they continually are so whenever I eat here. Sometimes even the manager walks around and checks up on people. I wish I could come around here more often, but if I'm ever craving quality Mexican food it's worth the trip.

I don't know...Maybe I've been spoiled by a couple of better Mexican places. 
When I first moved here, I went to this place because it was really close to my house, and I remember thinking, "Wow! This is great and so close by. I can eat here 5 times per week."
But recently I re-visited, and came to the conclusion that this place is on the pricy side, (especially for lunch.)
It is the most expensive Mexican place that I've been to since I've lived here, but keep in mind that I've only been to 4 or 5.
The atmosphere is good, the service is good, the food isn't bad.
But the bottom line...The food just isn't worth the price.
Sorry.

Very disappointing. I ordered the chicken nachos as an appetizer, it was horrible! Most probably the worst I've ever had! My son asked for sour cream on the side with his meal and was charged $3.00! They also charge $4.50 for a cup of sopa de fideo, (an item that is free of charge at Lindo Michoacan when ordering an entree). Lastly, my husband's stomach did not agree with the food....

I have never had such a terrible meal in Las Vegas. The chicken enchilada was terribly salty and almost inedible. The margarita was alright but not that great. Our server seemed super busy even though there were only 5 tables in our section and 3 servers working the section. He came by with an arm full of dishes and said I'll be right with you.

It took us 10 minutes to get our order take. Another 20 minutes to get our food after we had poked and prodded the tasteless salsa that was left at our table. My husband's fajitas were served with cold tortillas. Between the slow service and cold, pasty, lifeless, salt infused food this was a total flop and we will not be returning ever.

this place is YUCK! Food taste like it just came right out from the can..even the rice seriously though this is not authentic Mexican food..food is just too expensive, kids meal for burrito substitute rice and beans for fries was about $8 and my kids did not eat it just the fries because the burrito was just nasty! No taste! All bland that dessert was not an option. Tamales!! Don't get me started! Tamales were non appetizing that the server had to take back because 2 were overcooked that the beef was burnt and the cheese tamale looked like overcooked chicken I'm not lying seriously it was not cheese! But the server said it was cheese and it only looks like that because of the sauce they cook it in..BTW being Mexican and my knowledge of REAL Mexican food, a cheese tamale is slices of cheese with jalapeno slices and salt, no sauce!! So yea did not pay for that crap..Save your Pesos and go elsewhere,, want real Mexican food go to North-town in Las Vegas where the place looks crappy to even eat at and I swear to you, that's where the best REAL Mexican food is served!
Fantastic tamales. The Pork are amazing!  Lots of food for your money as none of us could finish both tamales we got for lunch. Can't wait to go back and get a dozen of pork tamales for the family.

Maybe this place changed or I had a bad cook but the food is very expensive for its lack of quality. My fiancee and I had very over cooked fish, beef and chicken. Some of our tacos were soggy and there were only three tables occupied. Really wasn't an excuse for it. To pay so much for poor food though is a bad way to make business.

The best Mexican food in las vegas hands down.  The best service you could get.  They are always professional and give you your moneys worth.  Soup salad and unlimited chips.  Best chilli Rellanos in town.. best sauces..best salsas..HUGE PORTIONS.  They constantly refill your drinks and chips..and theres ALWAYS booths available because they have tons of space.
LOVE THIS PLACE! The food is always excellent and the service is outstanding! I frequent this restaurant at least three times a month!

I have been coming here for years and the few things that have yet to change is the decor, seating, and spiked margaritas. Sadly when I visited this last time, I noticed their tortillas had shrank, the red sauce is darker, and the chicken don't really taste like chicken. I still love their side dinner salads though. And hands down some of the most flavorful and strongest margaritas in town. Which I love. The service is great and the atmosphere is relaxing with old mariachis playing in the background. Definitely a good spot for family gatherings :)

This was our first time going here. The restaurant was clean, but could use some updating. Especially in the restroom. We ordered nachos, pozole, and a plate with a chili relleno and cheese enchilada. The nachos were okay, the enchilada was cold but the chili relleno was fantastic. Really good. The rice and beans that came with the plate were very bland. I didn't eat much of the pozole (I took it home for later and my dog got it ), but I did taste it and it was about average. My main reason for the two star review was the service and the bottled water. The kitchen got everything out quickly, but the server never refilled our glasses without being asked, and one of the bottles of water we were brought had algae growing inside of it. A LOT of algae growing inside the bottle. It was pretty gross. I doubt we'll go back.

Thank you, Nariza J. for responding to my review. I very much appreciate your effort to make things right. I do not know when I will be on that side of town again, but when I am, I will make it a point to stop by. I am willing to give the restaurant a second chance, simply because you took the time and effort and to respond. I have hopes that the issues I encountered will no longer be issues.

Love love love the margaritas here. Come for happy hour and they are super cheap! We always get a pitcher and share. Then we share the nachos. Beware these nachos are the best ones around. No nachos will ever compare to these. 2 people can share a small and 3 can share a large. We add carne asada to them and omg are they to die for. Do yourself a favor and try the nachos.

Doña Maria's was the first Mexican restaurant I went to when I first moved to Vegas. It was super close to my old office and we'd order lunch from here a lot. 

I've tried their tacos, tamales, and enchilada which are all alright. I'm not fond of tamales so, I can't be the judge of that. Although their name is Doña Maria's Tamales, I've heard mixed reviews about their tamales. But I don't care about that. What I do like are their bacon-wrapped prawns and chicken chimichanga.

Bacon-Wrapped Prawns:
Medium-sized prawns wrapped in crispy bacon. It comes with a slightly spicy dip. 4/5

Chicken Chimichanga:
The best chimichanga in my opinion. It comes with a side of guacamole, sour cream, lettuce and tomatoes. The filling is juicy while the fried tortilla stays crispy and golden brown. A recent tomato allergy discovery made me ask them to not put any tomatoes. I opened my to-go container, there was a stray cube of tomato - ok, fine, I removed the tomato and whatever it touched. However, there were tomatoes in my chimichanga! So, I immediately itched and stopped breathing. Good thing, Mountain View Hospital is nearby. But the problem is, despite all that, I still like their chimichanga. I'm starting to sound like Dustin Hoffman in "Meet the Fockers"..."but I want a chimichanga!!!" 5/5

We had dinner here this past week and I have to say that service is amazing but the food is just bleh. We had a guacamole appetizer: I've bought better tasting guacamole from the grocery store. I ordered a roasted half chicken with tortillas rice and beans. For $15 i could have ordered 3 times as much at El Pollo Loco and received way better food. The chicken was dry and tasteless, smothered with some kind of bland red sauce. The homemade tortillas that came with it were pretty good. My hubby got a tamale and it tasted way better than my chicken. My kids ordered the kids meal of chicken fingers and fries, and they liked theirs. It was just disappointing to pay for a $100 meal (including tip), for something I could have got for 1/3 of the price.

I have been eating here for more than 5 years. The food at Dona Maria is consistent and overall very good. There is plenty of seating and wait times are generally very short (less than 5 minutes). They make their tortillas on-site, the quality of the ingredients is better than you get in chain restaurants. 

The issues we have regularly are:
Uncomfortable booths. Some of the booths have just aged and are no longer comfortable.
Slow service when busy. When they are busy your server will often disappear for a lot longer than we would like. They do have a good bus staff so your drinks and salsa do stayed filled. But if you want to order food it can be extremely annoying.
When sitting on the South side of the building the ambient noise can get very loud.

If you don't mind dinner taking 75 minutes this place is fantastic.

Tonight, it was late and the early dinning crowd had already left.  We sat on the bar side of the restaurant which we have never done before.  There were a few other tables and one big group also sitting on this side.  

Our service was quick and friendly, we got a few of the tamales for appetizers and both ordered an entree.  The food was served quickly, hot, spicy, fresh, with good flavors.   We did have some left overs which I gladly ate the next day.  

It has been a while since we enjoyed a meal here, but it's good to know it is still fresh and service is great.

Muy buena comida y servicio. Me lo recomendaron por sus margaritas y fajitas, pero yo probe el pozole y me sorprendio el buen sabor que tiene.

Sabor autentico
Drinks were good, me and wifey had margaritas.  The service was fast and the food was pretty good. I do believe the timely service and friendly attitudes out shined the food.
This is our Saturday lunch spot. The food is really good and the margaritas are killer. Please do not drink them if driving. The service is awesome. Really, no complaints. Rare for me.

Decided to stop at this location before driving back to California on a Sunday afternoon.  Upon arriving, the store front and waiting area were inviting.  After being greeted, our hostess walked us to our booth.  Very open atmosphere.  Paintings on Wall made this place feel cultural if that's even a way of expressing the decor.  Since we came for the tamales, our review will be based just on that dish.

Order half a dozen.  Variety of cheese, chicken and beef.  Beef tamale was a good size portion.  Too plain for my taste.  I was expecting a more favorable and spicy taste to it.  I would give this tamal a 2 out of five.  Maybe I'm being biased since I come from Mexican culture that are known for great tamales.  

Cheese was 3 out of five
Chicken 3 out of five.

Overall, tamales didn't meet my expectations.  

Almost forgot.  Not happy with the fact that my Michelada was served in a glass more proper for a margarita. It also included ice cubes.  Thats a No No when it comes to a Michelada.  Not happy with that drink.

I brought my Boyfriend here because this is one of my favorite restaurants. He had never eaten here before. Our waiter Jesus was wonderful. Both of our meals were amazing. He had a Chimichanga and a Tamale with a salad. I had a Carne Asade plate with Sopa de Fideo. My Boyfriend absolutely loved his food and then some. He even says it's better than his Mom's. Don't tell her that. :)
Great food as always! Our server was attentive making sure our drinks were replenished.

I love love love this place. Excellent authentic Mexican food made to order. Fresh lime juice margaritas and fast service even though it's a sit down place. I have never had a bad experience here, and the food is just always excellent.

The ambiance is very casual but festive here, staff is usually friendly and attentive.
My favorite dish here besides their famous tamales is their chicken enchiladas dinner. It's like 13 bucks and includes a soup or salad plus a huge portion with rice and beans. Their sauces are all homemade. 

Also if you like nachos or carne asada fries their special cheese is freaking awesome. Best homemade nacho cheese I've ever had. The portion is super huge as well so great for starters or a meal for one hungry person. 

Margaritas as I mentioned are really good and I believe are like 12/13 bucks or the big one. So worth it. You'll feel great after one of them! So if you love Mexican food hit this place up!
best Mexican food in las vegas and the service is outstanding!! highly recommend!!!!

This is a 3.5 star place but again no half star system yet... hmm.

Okay People - we have to agree that there are not too many (if any) authentic mexican joints in town.  Basically, they serve food that a bunch of gringos will eat... just like everyone else.  I am ok with that, too.  

The food here is just fine, I would say it slightly above average amaricanized mexican food.  I can't go any further that that because their chile relleno is below average.  

I will tell you why I like this place.  It is a huge restaurant with plenty of room and very comfortable for 2 or a large group.  I do like the atmosphere here to.

I have been here atleast 25 times.  The service is always excellent.  

When you consider the whole package; food, service, venue, price... I would say I really like this place.

My husband and I love coming here. The food is great and the margaritas are amazing! The staff is always friendly and making sure we have enough salsa. One waiter Carlos has always treated us especially nice making it a point to always come over and say hi even when we are not in his section.

So...I'm from Texas and this is not quite like Texas Mexican food. Salsa tasted like pizza sauce. They charge you $11 for some mean in a fried tortilla and it comes with no rice and beans. No thank you.

Mexican food is gr8.  Tamales are the best.  Margaritas are OK.  Seafood enchiladas, Chile rellanos, tacos and shredded beef burritos are my favorites.  Service and ambience are good.  Good Mexican breakfast and cinnamon coffee.  Good for business lunch.
Came here for dinner to satisfy a enchilada craving and Doña Maria didn't disappoint. My fiancé had the tamales which they are known for and we would recommend the shredded pork ones as well.

I bought my dad a restaurant.com gift certificate since this is close to his office.  This is what he experienced.  He was not happy at all.  He said he  or his friend would never go back.  The staff was completely incompetent and did not want to give him the amount off that was stated on the gift certificate I gave him.  They kept trying to give him 10% off and acted like they didn't understand him.  He left money on the table and walked out.

Finally a place that makes TAMALES as big as me and mmmmm mmmmmm  ggooooooddddd!!!!!! My experience here was awesome to say the least i had a excellent meal everything was extremely fresh and well cooked . The service was spot on. The staff acted as if i was family and were extremely helpful on the menu rundown. We will definitely be back!!!
Over all opinion is three to three and a half stars.  Service is five star but food a bit greasy.  Tamales are excellent and we would highly recommend them.

I am starting to love this place, from the outside it doesn't look very big but as you enter into it the room just seems to keep going and going. Its well laid out and the décor is very typical of a Mexican Restaurant;  that being said maybe even an upscale Mexican Restaurant since you have a waiter, a food server and even a third guy floating around keeping dirty plates off the table and empty glasses full. 

They sit you at a table serve you a bowl of very good if not freshly made Salsa and a bowl of chips as you read over the large menu with plenty of tasty dishes to choose from.  I've had the Tamales and I've had the burritos and I have to say OMG to both.

Both were served with plenty of sides and it made me regret ordering the bean and cheese dips to go with the chips and salsa.  I took a sip of a few of the Alcohol drinks my GF ordered but didn't indulge myself and can only say that they were strong and had a great flavor and seemed to be well worth the cost. 
I will always be willing to come back here. 

I just noticed this from my previous review and wanted to make sure to add it here: Just remember to ask for a small side of guacamole or you will end up with a weeks supply to take home.

hands down the worst Mexican food ever. the guacamole seemed like it was store bought and it was all downhill from there. the presentation was horrible and so was the food. i will never ever ever ever go there again

My husband loves the dishes here. Even my parents when they fly in there first restaurant spot is here. Service is good... even when it's extremely busy they try to always pay as much attention needed. I come here and always think it's happy hour time.... LOL. Give me those  Margaritas any flavor !!! The frozen Margaritas alone get 5 stars!!

Had the dinner combo #17. Shredded beef taco, pork tamal, chili relleno, rice and beans. Rice and beans tasted old- like from yesterday. Taco was good. Chili relleno was okay, I've had better, it wasn't spicy at all. Tamal was good, lots of meat, not spicy. I placed my order to go, it took 10 minutes which is fast. I'm not sure if I'll go back, maybe to try the margaritas everyone says are amazing.
